requirement_1.title: Financial Independence
requirement_1.verification: Public disclosure of all income sources for past 3 years
requirement_1.threshold: Less than 10% of income from ZoaGrad-related entities

requirement_2.title: Track Record of Principled Disagreement
requirement_2.description: Demonstrated history of challenging authority or prevailing consensus
requirement_2.verification: Published critiques, dissenting opinions, or adversarial research
requirement_2.threshold: At least 3 documented instances of principled disagreement with powerful entities

requirement_3.title: Relevant Expertise
requirement_3.description: Expertise in governance, ethics, systems design, or related fields
requirement_3.verification: Academic credentials, professional experience, or recognized contributions
requirement_3.threshold: At least 5 years of relevant experience or equivalent credentials

requirement_4.title: Willingness to Rule Against ZoaGrad
requirement_4.description: Explicit commitment to rule against ZoaGrad's interests if warranted
requirement_4.verification: Signed statement of independence and commitment to constitutional principles

target_profiles.description: Scholar or practitioner with track record of criticizing AI governance systems
target_profiles.rationale: Provides adversarial perspective on AI decision-making and accountability

target_profiles.description: Constitutional scholar or political scientist with expertise in governance failure modes
target_profiles.rationale: Provides critical analysis of governance architecture and legitimacy mechanisms

target_profiles.description: Former government regulator or oversight official with experience in accountability
target_profiles.rationale: Provides practical experience in enforcement and compliance mechanisms

requirement_1.title: Stakeholder Nomination
requirement_1.verification: Nomination petition with at least 100 stakeholder signatures

requirement_2.title: Diverse Stakeholder Representation
requirement_2.description: Represent diverse stakeholder interests (not all aligned with ZoaGrad)
requirement_2.verification: Nomination by stakeholder groups with conflicting interests
requirement_2.threshold: At least 2 of 4 elected validators must represent stakeholder groups with interests that conflict with ZoaGrad

requirement_3.title: No Employment Conflicts
requirement_3.description: No employment or contractual relationship with SpiralOS or ZoaGrad
requirement_3.verification: Public disclosure of all employment and contracts for past 3 years
requirement_3.threshold: Zero employment or contractual relationship with SpiralOS or ZoaGrad

requirement_4.title: Term Commitment
requirement_4.description: Willing to serve 2-year term with option to extend
requirement_4.verification: Signed commitment to serve full term unless removed for cause
requirement_4.threshold: Unconditional commitment to serve full term

election_process.eligibility: All stakeholders (ScarCoin/EMP holders, contributors, community members, affected parties)
election_process.voting_method: Approval voting (vote for up to 4 candidates)

authority_1.title: Final Judgment on F2 Judge Appeals
authority_1.description: External Validator Council is the final authority on appeals from F2 Judge decisions
authority_1.scope: All F2 Judge decisions can be appealed to External Validator Council
authority_1.override: Can only be overridden by constitutional amendment (66% + 180 days)

authority_2.title: Authority to Halt Panic Frames
authority_2.description: External Validator Council can halt Panic Frames if deemed unjustified
authority_2.scope: If Panic Frames are triggered but External Validator Council determines the trigger was unjustified, they can halt the Panic Frame and restore normal operations
authority_2.override: Requires supermajority (66%) of External Validator Council

authority_3.title: Power to Recommend Constitutional Amendments
authority_3.description: External Validator Council can recommend constitutional amendments to stakeholders
authority_3.scope: If External Validator Council identifies systemic issues or governance failures, they can recommend amendments
authority_3.override: Recommendations are non-binding; amendments require 66% stakeholder approval + 180 days

authority_4.title: Ability to Remove F2 Judges for Cause
authority_4.description: External Validator Council can remove F2 Judges for misconduct, incompetence, or constitutional violations
authority_4.scope: If F2 Judge demonstrates pattern of misconduct or constitutional violations, External Validator Council can remove them
authority_4.override: Requires supermajority (66%) of External Validator Council + public justification

authority_5.title: Emergency Constitutional Interpretation
authority_5.description: External Validator Council can provide emergency interpretation of constitutional principles during crises
authority_5.scope: If system faces existential crisis and constitutional principles are unclear, External Validator Council can provide binding interpretation
authority_5.override: Emergency interpretations expire after 90 days unless ratified by stakeholder vote

mechanism_1.title: Public Decision Reasoning
mechanism_1.description: All External Validator Council decisions must be published with full reasoning
mechanism_1.format: Structured decision document with constitutional justification
mechanism_1.location: Public governance dashboard and VaultNode blockchain

mechanism_2.title: Annual Stakeholder Confidence Vote
mechanism_2.description: Each validator faces annual stakeholder confidence vote
mechanism_2.threshold: Must maintain >60% stakeholder confidence to continue serving
mechanism_2.consequence_of_failure: Validator is removed and replacement is elected/appointed

mechanism_3.title: Removal by Stakeholder Petition
mechanism_3.description: Validators can be removed by 2/3 stakeholder petition
mechanism_3.threshold: 2/3 of eligible stakeholders must sign petition
mechanism_3.process: Petition triggers immediate removal vote; validator removed if 2/3 vote for removal
mechanism_3.grounds: Misconduct, conflict of interest, failure to fulfill duties, loss of stakeholder confidence

mechanism_4.title: Financial Transparency
mechanism_4.description: All validator compensation and financial relationships must be publicly disclosed
mechanism_4.format: Structured financial disclosure with all income sources, assets, and potential conflicts

mechanism_5.title: Performance Metrics
mechanism_5.description: Validators are evaluated on performance metrics

metrics.description: Constitutional coherence of decisions (C_procedural, C_outcome, C_pluralistic)
metrics.measurement: Automated constitutional coherence score + stakeholder feedback

metrics.description: Time to decision on appeals and constitutional questions
metrics.measurement: Average time from appeal submission to decision (target: <7 days)

metrics.description: Frequency of ruling against ZoaGrad's interests when warranted
metrics.measurement: Percentage of decisions that rule against ZoaGrad (should be >0%)

compensation.rationale: Fixed compensation prevents conflicts of interest (validators should not benefit from system growth or decline)
compensation.amount_usd_equivalent: [To be determined by stakeholder input during Week 1-2 of 90-day roadmap]
compensation.payment_method: Stablecoin (USDC or equivalent) to avoid exposure to ScarCoin volatility

benefits.benefit_3: Travel reimbursement for in-person meetings (if applicable)

prohibited_compensation: ScarCoin or EMP tokens (to avoid conflicts of interest)
Performance bonuses tied to system growth
Equity or ownership in SpiralOS or ZoaGrad
Consulting fees or other payments from ZoaGrad

operational_procedures.meeting_frequency: Weekly (or as needed for urgent appeals)
operational_procedures.meeting_format: Virtual (with option for in-person quarterly meetings)
operational_procedures.quorum: 5 of 7 members required for binding decisions
operational_procedures.decision_documentation: All decisions documented with full reasoning and constitutional justification

appeal_process.step_1: Stakeholder submits appeal to External Validator Council (via governance portal)
appeal_process.step_2: External Validator Council reviews appeal and requests additional information if needed
appeal_process.step_3: External Validator Council deliberates (may include hearings with stakeholder and F2 Judge)
appeal_process.step_4: External Validator Council votes (secret ballot, supermajority required)
appeal_process.step_5: Decision published with full reasoning (within 48 hours)
appeal_process.timeline: Target: 7 days from appeal submission to decision (may be extended for complex cases)

conflict_of_interest_protocol.disclosure: Validators must disclose any potential conflicts of interest before each decision
conflict_of_interest_protocol.recusal: Validators with conflicts must recuse themselves from that decision
conflict_of_interest_protocol.enforcement: Failure to disclose conflicts is grounds for removal

table_3.name: validator_appeals
table_3.description: F2 Judge appeals to External Validators

implementation_timeline.ongoing: Annual confidence votes, quarterly performance reviews, continuous accountability
